title: Sri Lanka Stars to Feature in Saudi Arabia’s New Women’s World T20 Challenge
byline: Sri Lanka’s T20 star Chamari Athapaththu will headline her country’s squad in the inaugural Women’s World T20 Challenge in Saudi Arabia. The league will feature top players from over 35 nations, marking the first professional women’s cricket event in the kingdom.

title: India–Sri Lanka Women’s T20I Clash Set for Dec 21–30
byline: India will host Sri Lanka for a five-match women’s T20I series from December 21 to 30, with the first two games to be played in Visakhapatnam before the remaining fixtures will be played in Thiruvananthapuram.

title: Tri-Series Final: Pakistan vs Sri Lanka Tonight at Rawalpindi
byline: The stage is set for an exciting finale as Pakistan and Sri Lanka clash in the T20I Tri-Series 2025 final at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium tonight, Saturday, November 29, with the match scheduled to start at 6:30 PM IST.

title: Maldivian Government extends relief assistance for disaster victims in Sri Lanka
byline: The Maldives has decided to extend relief assistance to Sri Lanka through financial support of USD 50,000 and a donation of 25,000 cases of tuna cans, a statement from the Maldivian Foreign Ministry said.

title: Special visa relief for foreigners in Sri Lanka hit by adverse weather
byline: The Immigration and Emigration Department has announced a series of special visa facilitation measures to assist foreign nationals impacted by the adverse weather conditions currently affecting Sri Lanka.

title: Critical flood warning issued for Maha Oya Basin
byline: People living in the low-lying areas of the Maha Oya valley have been strongly requested to act with extreme caution as there is a potential for a high-risk flood situation at a severity not experienced in recent history in the low-lying areas of the Maha Oya valley.

title: Landslide strikes Rambuk-ela; 50 houses affected
byline: A landslide occurred in Rambuk-ela village, within the Alawathugoda Police Division in the Kandy District, at around 1.30 a.m. today (29).

title: Over 6,000 in safe centres, nearly 100,000 affected in Colombo
byline: Amidst a major flood risk in the Colombo District due to rise in water level of the Kelani Ganga, a total of 6,016 people of 1,217 families have been sheltered in safe centres by 9.00 am this morning, the Colombo District Secretary said.

title: 40 rescued from flood-trapped bus at Kala Oya
byline: At least 40 people, including a foreign woman, have been rescued from a bus swept by floodwaters on the Kala Oya Bridge along the Anuradhapura–Puttalam road.

title: Indian rescue team arrives in Sri Lanka to support disaster operations
byline: An Indian rescue team arrived in Sri Lanka this morning (29) to assist ongoing emergency and relief operations amid the severe weather affecting the country.

title: Flight delays, cancellations reported at BIA
byline: The officer in charge at the Bandaranaike Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) said yesterday evening (28) that a significant number of flights arriving and departing from the airport have been delayed or cancelled.

title: Main line trains suspended this morning due to flooding
byline: Train services scheduled to operate on the Main Line this morning have been suspended following flooding along several sections of the railway track, including areas in Daraluwa and Gampaha.

title: Risk of major flooding in Kelani River continues to rise
byline: The Department of Irrigation warned that the risk of severe flooding in the Kelani River is steadily increasing as water levels continue to rise.

title: Kelani River rise threatens Ambatale Water Plant; Colombo supply at risk– NWSDB
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) said that several water sources and water treatment plants under its management have been submerged due to the severe islandwide flooding.

title: Indian Air Force C-130 brings emergency relief supplies to Sri Lanka
byline: An Indian Air Force C-130 aircraft carrying urgently needed relief supplies for those displaced by the severe weather arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport in Katunayake at early this morning.

title: Rainfall expected to ease tomorrow as Cyclone ’Ditwah’ moves away
byline: The Department of Meteorology said the prevailing heavy rainfall is expected to ease significantly by tomorrow (30), as Cyclone ’Ditwah’ continues to move away from Sri Lanka toward India.

title: Rescue underway for flood-stranded bus passengers as President monitors operation live
byline: A major rescue operation is underway after a bus caught in rising floodwaters on the Kala Oya bridge along the Anuradhapura–Puttalam road was swept off course, forcing passengers to seek refuge on the roof of a nearby house.

title: U.S. commits USD 2 million for urgent relief efforts in Sri Lanka
byline: The United States has committed USD 2 million to support relief efforts in Sri Lanka, according to Ambassador Julie Chung.

title: Tourism hotline activated for visitors amid bad weather
byline: Sri Lanka Tourism has activated its 24-hour emergency hotline 1912 to assist visitors affected by the current severe weather.

title: Colombo Port operations temporarily halted due to severe weather
byline: The Colombo Port has temporarily suspended all operations due to adverse weather conditions, the Ports Authority confirmed.

title: 33 people rescued from Giribawa area by air force
byline: A total of 33 people stranded in the Giribawa area of Galgamuwa were rescued a short while ago by an Air Force MI-17 helicopter.

title: Entrance roads to Hanwella restricted amid rising floods
byline: All entrance roads to Hanwella town have been restricted due to severe flooding, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) confirmed.

title: Meteorology Department website temporarily unavailable
byline: The Meteorology Department has announced that its official website is temporarily offline due to technical issues.

title: US stands ready to support relief efforts in Sri Lanka
byline: The United States has extended deepest condolences to the people of Sri Lanka as Cyclone Ditwah continues to produce severe weather, flooding, and landslides.

title: Anuradhapura Prison inmates relocated due to flooding
byline: The Prisons Department said that all inmates at Anuradhapura Prison have been transferred to a temporary detention center at a local school and to Polonnaruwa Prison following severe flooding.

title: Major landslide blocks Welimada-Nuwara Eliya road; two bodies recovered
byline: A landslide near Keppetipola Police Station in Welimada has blocked the Welimada-Nuwara Eliya road. The Army and Police are currently conducting search operations, and two bodies have been recovered so far.

title: China says support to Sri Lanka victims on the way
byline: The Embassy of China in Sri Lanka expressed heartfelt condolences to the victims and extended sincere sympathies to the bereaved families and all those affected by the recent floods in Sri Lanka.

title: Broken fiber and power futages disrupt Sri Lanka communication networks: Deputy Minister
byline: The Deputy Minister of Digital Technology, Eranga Weeraratne, has attributed widespread communication problems across Sri Lanka to broken fiber cables and power outages caused by ongoing adverse weather conditions.

title: BIA launches mobile app for real-time flight information
byline: Passengers and the general public can now access the latest flight information for Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) through the newly introduced BIA Mobile App, airport authorities announced.

title: Digital Ministry moves to stop spread of weather misinformation
byline: The government is working with relevant institutions to identify and remove fake social media posts and news items that mislead the public with false information related to the ongoing adverse weather conditions, Deputy Minister of Digital Economy Eranga Weeraratne said.

title: Massive landslide reported in Ankumbura, Kandy
byline: A large landslide was reported this morning in the Ankumbura, Galkotuwa area in the Kandy District, local police confirmed.

title: Government issues updated payment instructions for disaster relief contributions
byline: The Government has issued updated Payment Instructions for Disaster Relief Contributions as certain contributors have experienced difficulties when transferring funds to the designated Central Bank accounts during the ongoing national relief efforts, President’s Media Division (PMD)said.

title: Flight delays and cancellations hit BIA
byline: Several flights arriving and departing from Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) have been delayed or cancelled dueto the prevailing bad weather, leaving many passengers stranded.

title: All passengers rescued from bus swept away by floodwaters on Kala Oya bridge
byline: All passengers trapped in the bus that was swept away by floodwaters on the Kala Oya Bridge along the Anuradhapura–Puttalam road have been successfully rescued, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) confirmed.

title: Airbus issues major A320 recall, threatening global flight disruption
byline: Europe’s Airbus (AIR.PA) said on Friday it was ordering immediate repairs to 6,000 of its widely used A320 family of jets in a sweeping recall affecting more than half the global fleet, threatening upheaval during the busiest travel weekend of the year in the United States and disruption worldwide.

title: Severe weather claims 123 lives as thousands displaced: DMC
byline: Sri Lanka continues to grapple with the devastating impact of recent adverse weather, with the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) confirming that the death toll has risen to 123 over the past few days. Authorities also report that 130 people remain missing as rescue and relief operations continue.

title: Donate only through verified sources, be mindful of unofficial requests: CBSL
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) requests the people who wish to donate for ongoing relief activities to be mindful of unofficial requests and donate only through verified sources.

title: Man dies as vehicle plunges into Senanayake Samudra canal
byline: A man was killed when a motor vehicle travelling from Iginiyagala to Ampara veered off the road and fell into the main left canal carrying water from the Senanayake Samudra, near the Polwatta Junction bridge, police said.

title: Death toll climbs to 132; 176 still missing – DMC
byline: The death toll from the ongoing adverse weather disaster has risen to 132, while 176 people remain missing, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) reported today.

title: Nearly 200,000 consumers face power outages amid severe weather
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has reported widespread electricity disruptions across the country, with nearly 200,000 consumers currently without power, Deputy General Manager Noel Priyantha said.

title: No statement issued on state officials’ duties during disaster: Bribery Commission
byline: The Bribery Commission denied issuing any statements as circulated in social media on how state officials should work during the disaster situation.

title: At least 300 Buddhist monks stranded at Anuradhapura Bikkhu University: Minister
byline: Operations are underway to rescue 300 Buddhist monks stranded at the Anuradhapura Bikkhu University, Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe said today.

title: DMC urges immediate evacuation from dangerous areas
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC), along with District and Divisional Secretariats, has reported that some residents are not evacuating high-risk areas despite continuous warnings.

title: Emergency declared Islandwide: Minister
byline: An islandwide emergency has been declared, Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe told the media.

title: Muslim school holidays extended due to adverse weather
byline: The Education Ministry has announced that school holidays given for all Muslim schools have been extended until further notice.

title: Flood warning extended for Deduru Oya Basin
byline: The flood warning for the Deduru Oya Basin, has been extended for an additional 48 hours.

title: 21 people reported Missing in Thulhiriya
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) has reported that 21 people are missing in the Monrovia Estate, located in the Thulhiriya area behind the Warakapola Magistrate Court. Authorities are currently coordinating search and rescue efforts to locate the missing individuals.

title: Critical flood warning issued for low-lying areas along Mahaweli River
byline: The Irrigation Department has issued a critical flood warning for several low-lying areas along the Mahaweli River following heavy rainfall in the river’s catchment areas.

title: SriLankan Airlines issues special notice to pilots and cabin crew
byline: SriLankan Airlines has issued a special announcement requesting all pilots and cabin crew members to urgently contact the Airline Crew Control Centre (CCC), following disruptions to communication systems caused by the prevailing situation in the country.

title: 15 dead, 50 injured in Kothmale landslide
byline: A sudden landslide in the Rambodagala area of Kothmale has claimed the lives of 15 people, authorities reported a short while ago.

title: Rising Kelani river could disrupt Western Province water supply
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has warned that water supply in the Western Province could be disrupted if the Ambathale Water Treatment Plant (WTP) is affected by rising Kelani River levels.

title: Australian prime minister becomes first to wed in office
byline: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has married his partner Jodie Haydon, becoming the country’s first leader to tie the knot while in office.

title: Telecommunication operators to prioritise emergency calls during disaster situation
byline: Telecommunication operators have agreed to prioritise emergency calls during the ongoing disaster situations while minimising network congestion.

title: Inclement weather: Death toll mounts to 153; 191 still missing
byline: The death toll from the ongoing adverse weather disaster has climbed to 153, while 191 people remain missing, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) reported today.

title: Cardinal calls upon all Catholics in Sri Lanka to help disaster victims
byline: Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith today urged all Catholic priests and associations within parish churches to get together in helping the disaster hit families and persons.

title: Jeevan holds grand wedding reception in luxury hotel in Colombo amidst devastation
byline: Opposition Parliamentarian and General Secretary of the Ceylon Workers Congress (CWC) Jeevan Thondaman who returned back to the country this week after a lavish wedding ceremony in Chennai, held a grand post wedding reception in Colombo last evening as the country grappled with a massive destruction from Cyclone Ditwah.

title: India deploys MI-17V5 helicopters for Sri Lanka disaster response
byline: Two MI-17V5 helicopters of the Indian Air Force (IAF) arrived in Sri Lanka this evening to assist with ongoing search and rescue operations amid the widespread devastation caused by severe weather across the island.

title: Evacuation alert issued as Ambatale flood barrier reaches critical level
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) has issued an urgent warning that the Ambatale flood control barrier is at risk of overflowing as water levels in the Kelani River continue to rise rapidly.

title: Pakistan Navy ship donates dry rations for Sri Lanka’s flood victims
byline: In a gesture of solidarity with Sri Lanka’s flood-affected communities, a Pakistan Navy ship currently on a goodwill visit to Colombo has donated dry rations and clean drinking water to support relief efforts.

title: Cyclone “Ditwah” 80 km from Jaffna
byline: The Meteorology Department has issued warnings as Cyclonic Storm “Ditwah” nears Sri Lanka, currently located about 80 km northeast of Jaffna and expected to move north-northwestwards.

title: RDA urges motorists to avoid Kandy route despite access being restored
byline: The Road Development Authority (RDA) says motorists can now reach Kandy town via the expressway to Kurunegala and through the Galagedara and Katugastota routes.

title: Sri Lanka, Pakistan to Observe Minute’s Silence Before Tri-Series Final
byline: Sri Lanka and Pakistan will observe a minute of silence before today’s Tri-Nation Series final in honor of those who have lost their lives due to the ongoing extreme weather conditions in Sri Lanka.

title: 11 elders dead in Pannala elderly home after sudden floods
byline: Eleven residents of an elderly care home in Nalawalana, Pannala, have died after sudden flooding swept through the facility, police said.

title: Fishing boats to be deployed for rescue operations
byline: The Fisheries Department has decided to deploy fishing boats to assist in rescue operations in affected areas.

title: Flooding shuts down Kandy water treatment plant: KMC
byline: The Kandy Municipal Council (KMC) announced that water supply within the Kandy Municipality area cannot be restored as the Greater Kandy Water Treatment Plant (GKWTP) in Gatambe has been flooded.

title: Prabath Chandrakeerthi appointed as Commissioner-General of Essential Services
byline: Prabath Chandrakeerthi has been appointed as the Commissioner-General of Essential Services, President’s Media Division (PMD)said.

title: Sri Lanka Tourism assures 24/7 support for visitors amid severe weather
byline: Sri Lanka Tourism announced that dedicated response teams are operating around the clock to assist tourists and industry stakeholders affected by the recent severe weather conditions. Officials said immediate support will be provided to ensure the safety and wellbeing of all visitors.

title: Blood Service urges donors to visit main centres
byline: The National Blood Transfusion Service (NBTS) has urgently appealed to donors to visit their nearest main blood banks to help maintain the country’s essential blood supply, Director Dr. Lakshman Edirisinghe announced today.

title: DMC introduces WhatsApp numbers to inform of disaster related issues
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) has introduced three WhatsApp numbers for people to inform their issues regarding the disaster situation.

title: Facebook party raided in Kotte, 34 arrested
byline: The Welikada Police raided a ‘Facebook party’ in the Athul Kotte area, resulting in the arrest of 34 individuals and the seizure of a significant quantity of illicit drugs, police said.

title: Wildlife bungalow bookings for January to begin on December 8
byline: The Wildlife Conservation Department announced that bookings for wildlife tourist bungalows in Sialkot National Park for the month of January will be carried out as scheduled on Monday(8), at the department’s head office in Battaramulla.

title: Cyclone Ditwah makes impact in India; heavy rainfall batters Tamil Nadu
byline: As Cyclone Ditwah moves towards southern India, heavy rainfall lashed parts of Tamil Nadu. Heavy rain accompanied by strong winds lashed the Kodiyakarai beach area near Vedaranyam.

title: Toll-free hotlines launched for women and children in distress
byline: The Ministry of Women and Child Affairs has announced the launch of two toll-free telephone hotlines to report cases of women and children in distress amid the ongoing emergency situation.
